title: Technical Project Manager - Workplace
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.Snowflake’s Workplace organization is responsible for designing and delivering programmatic features and services that reflect Snowflake’s culture to create an environment where people love to come to work, interact with their colleagues, and deliver exceptional results.  We are looking for an extraordinary individual that has substantial, hands-on experience managing internal and external relationships, while providing support for engaging programs for our employees that relate to technology driven solutions, while also promoting the objectives of our Workplace strategies. 
The TPM acts as a technology integration architect and project manager for all global programs throughout the Workplace organization for a wide range of technology, data, F&B, EH&S, and sustainability related initiatives. This position assists a larger Programs team to develop, lead, and facilitate company wide workplace technology, service and training, and implementation and management of complex technology related projects which support the company’s goals and priorities. 
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Support the successful pursuit of the Workplace Strategic Plan and priorities as well as departmental and company improvement plans by defining, delivering, and supporting the implementation of workplace technology. Participate in committee activities and collaborate with others on system development, integration, and implementation of systems tools with other training and technology related infrastructure, equipment and software.  Innovate by partnering with staff, identifying specific needs and developing unique and sustainable solutions that can scale throughout our global portfolio. 

Provide project management across the Workplace organization and Technology integrated teams for the purpose of planning, implementing and evaluating team projects in a manner that coordinates project goals and operational features.
Coordinate and integrate Technology projects in collaboration with Site and Regional Managers.
Create content-specific information to ensure standards, operational procedures, and technology related equipment and solutions are communicated within our workforce while respecting the local culture and aligning with Snowflake’s values.
Develop communication templates and processes for sharing Workplace programs strategies and operational information.
Work in collaboration with the Workplace team to develop and design Technology driven solutions that glean data driven insights which help create informed decisions, ultimately relating to reduced Capital and Operational spend.
Ensure projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project
Engage internal resources (Workplace, Finance, IT etc.) and external vendors to ensure timely and effective progression of projects
Work with Program Managers and vendors to ensure on-time achievement of project milestones and deliverables
Engage internal resources and external vendors to ensure timely and effective close out of projects and, where applicable, handoff to other resources.
Create, track, and maintain schedules for multiple projects.
Effectively orchestrate projects across cross-functional teams of varying sizes.
Create and maintain project metrics, KPIs, and success criteria for technology and data projects
Keep project stakeholders apprised of updates via timely communication
Work with minimal supervision, under the general direction of Workplace Technology Lead.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Required qualifications to effectively perform the job at the time of hire. An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered. Additional requirements and/or substitutions may be requested and require the approval of the hiring manager.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must meet the following requirements or equivalent corporate experience:

Minimum of two years’ experience in the technology and workplace program field with integration of technology, operations, data mining, analytics and reporting. 
Real estate tech experience and knowledge with systems such as:

Computer Aided Facility Management (CAFM)
Integrated Workplace Management System (IWMS)

Systems such as Tango Analytics, Serraview, Facility360, etc.

Sensors and Data Collecting Devices

Density, Vergesense, IAQ sensors etc.

Digital Twins and Data Modeling
Building Management and Building Automation Systems

Systems such as Siemens, Alerton, ACL, etc.


Experience with managing, configuring, and maintaining technology systems and tools.  
Experience with integration of technology, operations, program development, data analytics and reporting.
Formal experience evaluating effectiveness of programs and systems resulting in recommendations for improvements.
Technical solutions experience within a large-scale tech company in the role of technology consultant or data analytics PM.
Expert in the area of Data science, technology solutions and industry wide trends.
Data categories as follows:

Hindsight (analysis of past events)
Insights (analysis of current performance)
Foresight (data science and predictive analytics) 

Experience with visualization tools such as:

PowerBI, Tableau, ThoughtSpot

In depth knowledge of Smart buildings and its technology / trends / developments
Experience developing user stories and needs analysis for the development of KPI’s

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Professional training, and/or experience that may be helpful in performing the job, if applicable.  Project management certification (PMP) a big plus.  Experience evaluating client concerns or needs and developing comprehensive solutions based upon the true sources of the issue through effective listening and Socratic type questioning. Experience with reporting metrics, word processing, spreadsheets, and flowcharting applications, as well as project management software. 
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Normal office/tech industry environment with moderate noise levels.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.  Must be able to work at desk/computer for extended periods of time.  Must be able to have repetitive wrist/hand/finger movement to work on computer and/or related office equipment.
Travel up to 15% may be required.

questions.label: Where have you most recently worked?
Have you worked at Snowflake in the past in a Full-time, Part-time, contractor or Intern capacity?
For Snowflake to anticipate possible immigration timelines and obligations, could you confirm you are currently authorized to work in the country to which you are applying?

Will you require sponsorship to continue or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future (Example – including but not limited to: work permits such as H-1B in the United States, Highly Skilled Migrant in the Netherlands or a Blue Card in Poland or Germany. This could also include change of sponsorship from your current employer to Snowflake)?
A “U.S. person” is a citizen, legal permanent resident, or legal temporary resident (i.e., a refugee or asylee) of the United States. Which of the following best describes your “U.S. person” status?

values.label: I am a citizen of Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria AND I am NOT a U.S. person.
None of the above; I am a citizen of a different country.

questions.label: [US Applicants Only] Are you subject to any post-employment restrictions based on your role as a government (federal, state, local, or otherwise) employee or contractor, including representational restrictions or restrictions arising from work on a government procurement?
Due to SEC auditor independence requirements, please let us know whether you have previously worked at, or if currently working at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), who is our independent auditor.

values.label: Yes - I have previously worked at, or is currently working at PwC.
No - I have never been employed by PwC.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
